roleset.name: (cause to) get overly hot
roleset.note: OVERHEAT-V NOTES: Frames file for 'overheat' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entry cooking 45.3 (fits one type of usage of this roleset). (from overheat.01-v predicate notes)

example.name: adjectival
example.text: The economy's slowdown is due only partly to the austerity program launched in September 1988 to cool an overheated economy and tame inflation.

example.name: unaccusative
example.text: And unlike 1987, [the economy]-1 doesn't appear [*-1]to be in any danger of overheating.

example.name: agentive
example.text: John overheated the pan and burnt his pancakes.
